Grace in the Margins
Start Here

Start Here

If you’re not sure where to begin, these guided reading paths are offered as companions, not instructions.

Choose the path that best reflects where you are right now.
There is no right order. There is no rush.

If You Are Suffering or Waiting

Sometimes the ache is not only the pain itself, but the long waiting that follows. These readings are offered as quiet company for seasons of grief, uncertainty, and endurance.

  • Be Still
  • The Gift of Now
  • If God Is Everywhere
  • When Jesus Wept
  • A Meditation in Suffering
  • New Every Morning

If You Are Wrestling With Sin, Failure, or Shame

These readings do not minimize consequences or offer quick relief. They speak to the experience of reckoning, repentance, and the slow work of restoration—without turning away.

  • The Bitter Harvest of Sin
  • Jesus – The Scapegoat
  • Purify My Heart
  • From Ashes to Glory
  • In the Margins

If You Feel Spiritually Numb, Dry, or Disconnected

There are seasons when faith remains, but feeling does not. These readings are meant to reawaken attention—to help you notice where nourishment may still be quietly present.

  • What Are You Feeding?
  • Seek His Face, Not Just His Hand
  • Mustard Seed Faith
  • Look and Live
  • Faith, From Beginning to End

If You Long to Know Who You Really Are

When life fractures, identity often follows. These readings return to Scripture’s quieter affirmations—where naming, calling, and belonging are restored over time, not declared all at once.

  • What's In A Name
  • After God's Heart
  • Held on Every Side
  • Working from Grace

If You Learn Best Through Story and Image

Some truths enter the heart more easily through story than through explanation. These readings invite imagination and reflection, allowing meaning to surface gently rather than being argued into place.

  • The Gospel in the Grass
  • I Wanna Dance Like Enoch Danced
  • The House That Calls to the Simple
  • Fractured Light

If You Are Learning to Sit With God

There are seasons when words feel unnecessary and striving has grown thin. These readings invite you to slow down, remain present, and rediscover that God does not withdraw when nothing seems to be happening.

  • Be Still
  • The Gift of Now
  • A Holy Moment
  • Here With Me
  • The Work of Your Fingers

If You Are Relearning Grace

When faith has become effortful and obedience feels heavy, these readings return to grace as the starting place—not the reward. They are offered to help loosen the grip of self-reliance and restore rest to your walk with God.

  • Working From Grace
  • Faith, From Beginning to End
  • Mustard Seed Faith
  • From It or Through It
  • In the Margins

If You Are Seeking Wisdom Without Noise

These readings are for those who want clarity without pressure and wisdom without spectacle. They attend to Scripture's quieter guidance, where discernment grows slowly and faith is formed through attention rather than urgency.

  • The House That Calls to the Simple
  • Roadblocks
  • What Are You Feeding?
  • Psalm 119
